addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

6 N
o
1591
. M
r
Bodeleie to my L.

page.lettertext:
fol.174r
May it please yo
r
good L. I am earnestly
intreated by divers persons of q
a
litie, to write
a second letter in
e favo
r
of one
Herman Ro-
denburgh
of
Amsterdame,
who at his being in
England
assistant to
e last Deputies of the
g
nr
al states
, was arested by one
Gerard
of
Malines,
upon pretence of a certaine debt.
Happely
e cause in question being ancient, and
my former letter
written
above 6 monethes agoe, it
can not come so readily to yo
r
L. memory.
But
M
r
Caron
, I am told, will acquaint yo
w
very thorowly, w
t
as muche as shall be re-
quisit. Upon
e intelligence wherof, if it please
yo
r
L. finding it a suite
at deserveth some
favo
r
, to make it knowen unto
e parties,
at
I have not failed to remember yo
w
of it, I
shall finde them
e willinger, to further those
affaires, wherein my service in this place may
neede their assistance.
And so I take my
humble leave. At
e Hage. N
o
6 1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden. Tho. Bodley
